channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Family of 3yo killed in mosque attacks confront gunman: 'True justice is waiting for you in the next life'
item.description: Little Mucaad Ibrahim, the youngest victim from the Christchurch mosque attacks, used to run around his family's home pretending to be a police officer.

item.title: Five new cases of Covid-19, three in community, two in isolation
item.description: Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield says five people associated with a Mt Roskill church have been diagnosed with Covid-19 in the past few days.

item.title: Mandatory masks: Taxi firm fears for passenger safety
item.description: Mandatory mask rules for passengers in taxis and ride-share vehicles are creating uncertainty for cab companies over what will be required of their drivers.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and the world on 26 August
item.description: National Party leader Judith Collins says it's not a good enough excuse for the government to say they could not work out the admin for extending the wage subsidy.

item.title: Mosque attacker's sentencing: Victim statements to court continue
item.description: A former Christchurch city councillor, who is supporting mosque attack victims in court, says it has been a "cathartic" experience for people to let out 18 months of hurt and anger.

item.title: Covid-19 testing: Auckland clinics confident of reaching 70,000 target
item.description: Auckland healthcare providers say the 70,000 testing target set out over the next seven days is achievable, despite the number of swabs taken in the community starting wane.

item.title: Family frustrated about lack of warning about major building development on doorstep
item.description: A Lower Hutt family has accused the council of running roughshod over them, by prioritising houses over their wellbeing.

item.title: Shallow quake near Christchurch
item.description: A shallow 3.3 magnitude quake has rattled Christchurch.

item.title: Warning to pet owners after illegal poison drop on Te Araroa Trail
item.description: The Queenstown Lakes District Council has received reports of members of the public placing poison within its parks and reserves.

item.title: Some Auckland students feel 'disadvantaged by lockdown', schools planning catch-up classes
item.description: Schools are thinking about asking some students who are planning to leave at the end of the year to return next year to complete credits.

item.title: WhangƒÅrei man pleads not guilty to murder
item.description: A man has denied murdering a man in Whenuapai at the start of the month.

item.title: Defence Force accused of neglecting sexual violence programme
item.description: Advocates for victims are accusing the Defence Force of a lack of commitment after it left a crucial sexual violence programme leaderless for years.

item.title: South Auckland doctors provide more test sites for community
item.description: South Auckland doctors are setting up their own Covid-19 test sites to encourage anxious communities at the heart of the current outbreak.

item.title: Crews to check site of huge Wellington house fire
item.description: Investigators are working out how to access a landmark Wellington house burned out in a fire last night to check no one was inside.

item.title: Community testing must continue long-term, GPs warn
item.description: As the government races to test 70,000 people in seven days, GPs are warning it must get community testing back on track long-term.

item.title: Covid 19: What happened on 25 August
item.description: New Zealand reported seven new cases of Covid-19 today, with the Ministry aiming for 70,000 tests to be completed over the next week.

item.title: Wellington cat Mittens butts up against Covid security
item.description: Wellington's famous cat, Mittens, is facing some Covid-19 restrictions of his own, following multiple attempts to enter an isolation hotel.

item.title: Large house fire in central Wellington
item.description: Fire has torn through a historic Wellington house, with dozens of neighbours evacuated.
